p: In the previous study by Mirjalili et al., antibacterial activity of essential oils from L. officinale at different fruiting stages (immature, mature and ripened) of the plant has been studied against Bacillus subtilis, Staphylococcus epidermidis, S. aureus and Escherichia coli. The mature and ripened fruit oils showed activity with MIC values of 0.9â€“1.8 mg/ml against B. subtilis, S. epidermidis. Also the essential oils at these stages exhibited sensitivity against E. coli with MIC=7.2 mg/ml ( 7).
